comment: Gave you zero credit if you didn't engage in every single discussion or if you just didn't ask questions in class. Online discussions due dates were never discussed in class or on the calendar so they closed before anyone even knew they were there. All work is busy work. My french has not improved at all in this class.

I am obsessed with French, but I hated this class. Lot's of projects and participation points. She's nice and will try to help you, but she won't really correct your French. My French didn't improve, even though I got an A. There are no tests.

I'm a French minor, and it's something I've always been good at, but this class was honestly the one I was most worried about. Although she's extremely nice, her directions aren't always clear. In addition, when she gives assignments, she doesn't immediately tell you the due date. It could be weeks later before you know when something is due.

I'm a French major and was excited about taking a French Conversation class. She's a nice woman, but I don't feel like I learned much. I'm more comfortable speaking and making mistakes, but that's due to the work I did outside of class, practicing with French club. A ridiculous amount of homework, very little of it related to conversation skills.

She is the best French 1001 professor at KSU if you really want to learn. Her teaching style is the best and makes you confident. Class conducted in a circle so you get to know your classmates and Dr. Hoyt very well. She is a really nice lady and very helpful. Take this class. It's easy and you WILL learn!

There is so much room for this class to be engaging and fun. I'm nearing the final week of the semester, and I have learned RIEN. She is a nice woman, but this class is boring. She doesn't correct your spoken french during class. She just gives a sympathetic nod. No more purple sheep. Fruit should be eaten, not worn on the head. Gives us articles.

Hoyt means well.  Nice woman and means to have her students succeed but does not host the class as such. Extremely disorganized and just generally an awful class. I dreaded going and her grading system just sucks.  You'll have oui/non, 9 out of 10 and things like that so you have no idea what your true grade is.  BUt you can do well, i guess.

I really liked Dr. Hoyt. She was very fair. She won't compare you to the rest of the class but rather she just wanted to see that you were trying. She's very sweet and she's super helpful if you meet with her outside of class. Work hard on the presentations and don't skip class!!!!

This teacher is by far one of the most interactive ones at KSU! She makes us sit in a "U" shaped style and is involved 100%! She helps you understand the pronunciation and correct grammar use, hard on on her writing extremely, but easy on other assignments. Fun teacher, hard grader though! Loved her!

I dont know why people are saying she was mean, she was too nice! Seriously she never called anyone out. As far as papers go, I found her to be harsh (as needed though) and I liked that the students had a say in what we learned. I would take another course of hers.

This is a Professer who thinks she knows everything.She does not like students who does not do things her way. She is also rude!! and condescending to students. Her teaching style is, that you better know the language when you come in the door. She is old and going a little nuts I think.Don't take her class, unless you like being belittled!!
She is nice but I found her boring. She just read what was in the book. I though her class was confussing
